metadata.title: CVE-2015-1206 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in Google Chrome before M40 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (unpaged memory write and processcrash) via a crafted MP4 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 2.6
libav-tools - 2.6
libavcodec-extra - 2.6
libavcodec-extra57 - 2.6
libavcodec57 - 2.6
libavdevice57 - 2.6
libavfilter-extra - 2.6
libavfilter-extra6 - 2.6
libavfilter6 - 2.6
libavformat57 - 2.6
libavresample3 - 2.6
libavutil55 - 2.6
libpostproc54 - 2.6
libswresample2 - 2.6
libswscale4 - 2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6').
